text: The Solanki Koli (also spelled as Saulanki Koli) is a clan (Gotra) of Koli caste mostly found in the Indian states of Gujarat and Rajasthan and Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu. == Jagirs == The Solanki Kolis of Gujarat ruled over petty Princely states in Chunval region (now Becharaji) of Gujarat named as Bhankoda, Kukvav, Chaniar and Dekavada Jagirs. == Notable == *Madhav Singh Solanki, former three terms Chief Minister of Gujarat, former president of Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee, Minister of External Affairs (India), founder of Kham theory *Parshottambhai Solanki, State minister for Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying in Gujarat government *Hirabhai Odhavji Solanki, Member of the Legislative Assembly in Gujarat Legislative assembly *Natvarsinh Solanki, founder of Gujarat Kshatriya Sabha, Jagirdar in British India, Member of the Legislative Assembly in Bombay Legislative Assembly from 1952 to 1957 and 2nd term MLA in Gujarat Legislative Assembly from 1967 to 1972, Member of parliament in 7th Lok Sabha from 1980 to 1984. == References == Category:Koli clans
title: Solanki Koli
